visualization_prompt: Generate a map visualization showing geographic projection comparisons using dynamic projection switching between EqualEarth and WebMercator
visualization_explanation: The dataset consists of 20 synthetic numerical values mapped to world geometries. Synthetic indices (0-19) demonstrate projection mechanics while maintaining geographic integrity through topology relationships. Data quality is structurally valid through Highcharts' built-in topology but lacks real-world semantic meaning. The map visualization maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating chartjunk while maintaining essential borders and hover states. Projection switching leverages perceptual grouping principles through smooth transitions. Uniform color distribution (μ=9.5, σ=5.7) creates neutral basemap context. EqualEarth prioritizes area preservation while WebMercator demonstrates common web mapping distortion, enabling comparative cartographic analysis through Cairo's principle of informative contrast.
